awd_titl_txt: A Combined Experimental and Theoretical Study of Mist       Cooling of a Heated Surface
awd_abstract_narration: A combined experimental and theoretical investigation is conducted to           study the phenomenon of mist cooling of a heated surface.  In the               experimental investigation, extensive use will be made of the recently          developed two-phase suspension flow laser-Doppler particle-sizing               anemometry techniques at Stony Brook to measure the dynamics of the two         coupled phases in the mist which leads to droplet deposition.  In the           theoretical investigation, new aproaches will be developed towards an           understanding of the droplet deposition phenomenon based on a new               theory of the dynamic response characteristics of a particle in a               turbulent flow.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
